website_summaries.verdict: The Sennheiser RS 195 headphones do a great job helping those with hearing loss listen to audio from televisions and stereos wirelessly.
pros: Comfortable wireless headphones with high-quality audio performance
Multiple adjustable listening modes that accentuate different frequency ranges
Can adjust panning to make one ear louder than the other

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I am so relieved these headphones are so very good - primarily, because I felt so very guilty ever since I pushed the acquisition key! Cheap they are not - gulp - but they are quite simply the best headphones I have ever owned. And by quite a distance as well. Others have provided excellent analysis re the technicalities of this item, so I will not bore anyone to death with my own views on the same. All I will say, is if you are in the market for some seriously good headphones, you could do much worse than these beauties - at any price!
customer_reviews.author: DBWM

customer_reviews.title: Drop dead gorgeous sound
customer_reviews.text: I first tried wireless headphones about six years ago or so and they were awful. Fast forward to now and I wanted to be able to enjoy watching TV without waking the neighbours or generally causing noise pollution. Suffice to say, wireless headphones have come on a LONG way. These wireless headphones deliver sound that is comparable to my hardwired £300 pair of Beyerdynamic MMX300s. Summary? They are pricy, but once you hear them, you'll be in love.
customer_reviews.author: Peter George Eveleigh Jerrard

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, I can now hear what is being said
customer_reviews.text: For the hard of hearing these headphones are a wonderful discovery. I can now view a video/film and actually hear the dialogue So much better and clearer than hearing aids or regular headphones. They seem have the same audio correction algorithms as a hearing aid, but a much more powerful diaphragm to create the sound The only reason for giving 4 stars rather than 5 is that they leak audio to the extent that my wife could hear the dialog. They are closed back headphones and should not do this. Its a design fault. Fortunately the problem can be corrected by carefully using narrow black sticky tape to cover the gap on each of the headphones
customer_reviews.author: PhilC

customer_reviews.title: sound volume too low
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older model but I can hardly hear the sound, nowhere near good enough. I have a similar set up bought for one fifth of the price works like a charm. this is going back. Why should this model at five times more than a cheap model have such poor sound volume?
customer_reviews.author: P. Hayler

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.text: I think they are better than any wireless headphones I've used before. The 3 differet music setting is very useful for current films but the middle setting is probably more suited to older films without a huge ochestral score.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A. Wilton

customer_reviews.title: My RS 195 head set means I can enjoy TV and music like never before
customer_reviews.text: I have 79% hearing loss in left ear and 26% loss in my right. My RS 195 head set means I can enjoy TV and music like never before. Excellent .
customer_reviews.author: Graeme Smith

customer_reviews.title: For me, one star, but for many probably five.
customer_reviews.text: I have rated the product not my disabled experience. Probably for a hearing user they are excellent, but being hard of hearing they were useless for me. I found insufficient volume and no bass/treble adjustment impossible to tailor to my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Critic

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Really great, has improved T.V. 100%. My hearing as been getting poor over the last few years, and I hadn't noticed how much I had missed, these have changed my whole viewing experience. With these earphone I can enjoy films in stereo again excellent !! They work, however I do feel they are over priced, in what you get for your money with todays techno products.
customer_reviews.author: Raymo

customer_reviews.title: Very clear sound and as they are closed back others ...
customer_reviews.text: Very clear sound and as they are closed back others cannot hear what you do! I do have dodgy hearing (tinnitus) and have experimented with the sound profiles available and they make subtle changes that enhance what you are listening to. Overall a big improvement on my previous model the HDR180 that were not popular with she who must be obeyed as they were open back so caused too much noise if she was in the same room.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Corteen

customer_reviews.title: great headphones
customer_reviews.text: Following research and review of others' experiences opted for these headphones. Excellent piece of equipment. Excellent reception throughout our home (modern build without solid walls) and some reception outside (i.e. through windows). TV can be listened to at a different volume to others, including when volume muted. Cannot fault them or Amazon's service.
customer_reviews.author: Donal O'Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for TV
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality, easy setup. Being hard of hearing I purchased these primarily for use whilst watching TV. A truly total encompassing sound - such that I have not experienced for many years. Expensive yes, but they ooze quality and more importantly perform wonderfully! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Sandford

customer_reviews.title: She picked a profile pretty arbitrarily it seemed to me and never uses the ...
customer_reviews.text: Wife can hear TV again now. She picked a profile pretty arbitrarily it seemed to me and never uses the special dialogue mode but she's happy and therefore so am I.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have a hearing problem listening to TV but these have been a godsend
customer_reviews.author: Clive_R-D

customer_reviews.title: comfortable headphones not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: dont waste your money the balance control is totally uneccesary and the personal listening control does very little to enhance your listening the rs175 is a better option i have both have since bought the rs 165 which in my opinion is the best of the sennheiser range
customer_reviews.author: mario

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound quality ... A definite from my previous RS180
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Poor volume.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a hearing problem you will find that the maximum volume may not be loud enough for you to enjoy your music.
customer_reviews.author: MR JAMES RITCHIE

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed!
customer_reviews.text: the sound is too synthetic for such an expensive headphones.
customer_reviews.author: M Alam

customer_reviews.title: VERY POOR
customer_reviews.text: I HAD TO RETURN THESE AS THE SOUND WAS TERRIBLE AND HARDLY ANY VOLUME
customer_reviews.author: DAWN R.

customer_reviews.title: Kill the echo.
customer_reviews.text: These are cracking headphones with excellent pre-settings for speech through to music, tactile headphone controls, and muffs which cover the whole ear. But the best news is that I accidentally discovered how to abolish the latency problem. I used a scart plug to plug the transmitter into my Sky box and NOT the TV audio out. All reverb and echo completely vanished. Try it -- it really works.
customer_reviews.author: Osprey

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed and I will be returning these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I just bought the RS 195 after a lot of research. The volume is nowhere near high enough for movies/TV. I am quite a techie and have tried all settings. Really disappointed and I will be returning these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: G. Saunders

customer_reviews.title: I really like the 195s.
customer_reviews.text: Forget the previous posting. Some of the best electronics today are made in china............ think of Apple etc. The 195s are truly great headphones and Fantastic for just wandering pretty much as much as you want around the house, I have mine linked to an Axtell and Kern 120 ii and the sound is great for an unwired piece of kit. TV sound is damn impressive and the best bit is they fit like a perfect pair of gloves. Highly recommended........ does what they say on the tin. DF
customer_reviews.author: DAVID FOSTER

customer_reviews.title: Not fit for purpose.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my father who has assisted hearing. They are useless, not fit for purpose at all. He cannot turn the volume loud enough for them to be of any use as there is a constant echo. If he listens at the volume which does not produce an echo then this is not loud enough for the rest of the family. There is a delay in getting the audio to the headphones, which is frustrating and produces an echo. Defeats the whole object of them supposedly being the greatest benefit to those with assisted hearing. Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

product_meta.title: Sennheiser RS195 Personal Hearing Wireless Headphone
product_meta.description:
Braun introduces Silk Epil 9, the enhanced standard of epilation excellence with a wide epilation head for faster results and breakthrough MicroGrip tweezer technology.

BOX CONTAINS
1x HDR headphones
1x TR transmitter
1x Power supply with 4 adapters (EU, UK, US & AU)
2x AAA LSD NiMH rechargeable batteries
3.5mm audio cable 2m
Optical cable 1.5m
Quick Guide
Instruction Manual CD
Printed compact manual
feature_bullets: Closed, circumaural headphones with excellent digital wireless audio transmission
Exceptional digital audio clarity and transmission range of up to 328ft/100m (line of sight)
Multi-purpose transmitter - also functions as 'easy-charge' cradle and docking station
Selectable hearing boost presets and an Additional noise suppression mode for clearer dialogues and superior speech intelligibility
Balance control for right/left volume adjustment

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
